result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M. Scholz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.
- Restitution in the amount of $2000.00 to the Crime Victim Compensation fund,
- All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and victim witness); 
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  Court ordered that restitution be paid  through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by DOC.from 25% of prison funds.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Court ordered restitution and cost be paid within 20 years.

Consecutive to: with 0 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the defendant is eligible to petition for release to extended supervision after serving 42 years.
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court further advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any body armor.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with:  with 0 days credit CONCURRENT with Count 1.

Per Order Dated October 12, 2021, Appeal No. 2019AP1725-CRNM,
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of the circuit court is summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Angela Conrad Kachelski is relieved of any further representation of Scholz in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

per order dated April 15, 2019, Appeal No. 2019XX259-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Scholz to file a postconviction motion or a notice of appeal is extended through June 18, 2019. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a) (2017-18).

per order dated February 18, 2019, Appeal No. 2019XX259-CR; IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Scholz to file a postconviction motion or a notice of appeal is extended through April 18, 2019. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a)(2017-18).
received and filed.

per order dated November 28, 2018, Appeal No. 2018AP1981-W, IT IS ORDERED that the petition is granted and that, as a remedy, Scholz's postconviction and appellate rights under Wis. Stat. Rule 809.30 are reinstated effective immediately. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this matter is referred to the State Public Defender for appointment of postconviction and appellate counsel to represent Scholz, such appointment to be made within thirty days after the date of this order. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30(2)(e). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the State Public Defender shall notify this court within five days after the appointment of successor postconviction and appellate counsel to represent Scholz. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for Scholz to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30 is extended through the date sixty days after the appointment of successor postconviction and appellate counsel and further deadlines shall be governed by the rules of appellate procedure and the orders of this court.

per order dated October 18, 2018, Appeal No. 2018AP1981-W, IT IS ORDERED that, no later than November 1, 2018, Scholz shall submit an appropriately verified petition. Failure to submit an appropriately verified petition on or before the deadline stated will result in dismissal.
Acknowledgement of Filing of Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus by Court of Appeals.
Amended (Verified) Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to Reinstate Direct Appeal Rights, received.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew M. Scholz in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Andrew M. Scholz is in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   State has satisfied victim notification.   PSI reviewed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  life in prison with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the defendant is eligible to petition for release to extended supervision after serving 42 years.
As to Count 2:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  10 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT with Count 1;  the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS. 

Court ordered the defendant to:
- Provide a DNA sample

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.
- Restitution in the amount of $2000.00 to the Crime Victim Compensation fund,
- All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and victim witness); 
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  Court ordered that restitution be paid  through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by DOC.from 25% of prison funds.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Court ordered restitution and cost be paid within 20 years.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court further advised defendant that as a convicted felon hemay never possess any body armor.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

CASE RECALLED....SAME APPEARANCES....

As to Count 1:
At the hour of 4:48 P.M. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied Defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

As to Count 2:
At the hour of 4:48 P.M. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied Defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court ordered PSI no recommendation by writer.
Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms (body armor); also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
